title._content: Reg Harris wins quarter final of 1000m cycle race, Olympic Games, London, 1948

description._content: Reg Harris (1920-1992) was a cyclist from Lancashire. He joined the 10th Hussars in World War II and was a tank driver in the North Africa campaign before being wounded and invalided out of the services. Despite his discharge he went on to win the World Amateur Sprint in Paris in 1947 and won Olympic Sprint silver and Olympic Tandem Sprint silver in 1948.
